page.title: 03Plants and Wildlife
page.content: The lane verges support the greatest variety and number of wild flowers. These have noticeably increased since spraying stopped and the verges are cut only two or three times a year. Primroses and violets are common and the white violet is also found. Honeysuckle and dog rose reappear on the hedges annually despite use of mechanical hedgecutters. The River Dove supports a stock of wild brown trout and grayling and annual stocking with brown trout is also carried out. Water rats can be seen also kingfishers and herons. There is a small heronry just south of the area. Magpies have increased dramatically in the last few years and the area is inhabited by tawny and little owls. Brown hares are common and rabbit numbers have built up sufficiently to be a nuisance.
